column4: I wonder if it is possible to first install Kubuntu Hoary CD and then install Ubuntu Hoary CD, so that I get both KDE/Gnome?
Sure.
hmm
You'd probably want to just apt-get ubuntu-desktop from the disk before adding online sources, not try to do separate installs or something.
ok will try that
They run it overnight.  Or go to the library.
library here does not have a place where you can just hook your computer up.. maybe through wifi but I bet you that they will make you pay for it
dbernar1: Why install manually?  The CD works as an apt source.
I have free high-speed wifi at my library, dunno about you.
so if I install kubuntu, I change the disk to ubuntu (both Hoary), I can then simply mount the cd, change the sources.list to point to Ubuntu cd as well and then apt-get install gnome-desktop?
ubuntu-desktop, but yes.
thanks
better than nothing
For sure.  But doesn't respond well to complete sentences.
ah well, better than copying and pasting from sites for simple little queries :)
Yep.
mv foo.tar.bz2 foo.tar
That would be an issue then, yep.
I think spz2 just overwrote the MBR b/c of the Windows install, so needs to write grub back to it.
hmm well I was assuming totally full on linux install with no dualboot, etc
Nah, broke it after putting XP on afterwards.
heh, its supposed to be the other way round, seems like spz2 needs to get livecd to fix that up again
Could be, yeah.
lsof| grep apt
